comment.author: 35607158@N06
comment._content: In case people are wondering about her Debbie Roel She was the quintessential 1970s stewardess —before the dawn of the flight attendant—the neatly coiffed blonde with the Pepsodent smile and the pink-and-orange miniskirt who was plastered all over PSA print ads, commercials, billboards and ticket envelopes. Even after one of her flights was hijacked to Cuba, Debbie Roel continued to smile, on camera and off. When USAir bought the homegrown airline in 1989 and retired the PSA name, Roel made the switch and continues to fly to this day. Now 47, she lives in La Jolla with her husband, ex–San Diego Gulls and Mariners center Joe Noris, and their three children. Source: www.sandiegomagazine.com/San-Diego-Magazine/November-1997...
